ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.

It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.

name: r-rngwell

about.summary: It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.

It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.10-10" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-rngwell
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/rngWELL_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/rngWELL/rngWELL_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 844499ce38622955a1d428a0ef62abe192bb2151a928c5bd933f34c062fd576f

build:
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}grep              # [win]
    - {{ posix }}autoconf
    - {{ posix }}automake          # [not win]
    - {{ posix }}automake-wrapper  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}pkg-config
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('rngWELL')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('rngWELL')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rngWELL
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  summary: It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__
    to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_3_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: rngWELL
# Type: Package
# Title: Toolbox for WELL Random Number Generators
# Version: 0.10-6
# Author: C code by F. Panneton, P. L'Ecuyer and M. Matsumoto and R port by Christophe Dutang and Petr Savicky <savicky@cs.cas.cz>.
# Maintainer: Christophe Dutang <christophe.dutang@ensimag.fr>
# Description: It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.0)
# License: BSD_3_clause + file LICENSE
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2020-01-20 12:37:12 UTC; dutang
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-01-21 09:30:02 UTC

about.summary: It is a dedicated package to WELL pseudo random generators, which were introduced in Panneton et al. (2006), ``Improved Long-Period Generators Based on Linear Recurrences Modulo 2'', ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software. But this package is not intended to be used directly, you are strongly __encouraged__ to use the 'randtoolbox' package, which depends on this package.
